title: Learning objectives
text: course introduction study design quantitative data analysis, including statistics, commonly employed linguistics, using R software. cover following topics: basics quantitative data analysis. Study design. principles data visualisation. Statistical modelling. Statistical inference using Null Hypothesis Significance Testing. Examples different branches linguistics used provide hands-experience quantitative data analysis Open Research practices. completion course gained following skills: Effectively address intended research questions quantitative methods. Using compelling visualisations communicate specific message patterns data. Master linear models different types data (continuous measures, counts, accuracy data, reaction times). Correctly interpret p-values confidence intervals avoid common interpretation pitfalls.

title: Learning objectives
text: following sections report learning objectives detail, broken week. week, can find set questions able answer end week set skills practice week.

title: Learning objectives
text: knowledge data? quantitative data analysis? can talk uncertainty? limits quantitative methods?

title: Learning objectives
text: Think critically “data”. Interpret basic numeric summaries plots. Use R perform simple calculations obtain numeric summaries. Master basics programming language R Learn manage analyses scripts RStudio.

title: Learning objectives
text: principles good data visualisation? main components plot? appropriate plots different types data? can visualise uncertainty?

title: Learning objectives
text: Create common types plots ggplot2. Use colour shape effectively convey meaning. Describe plot writing comment observable patterns. Write dynamic reports generate publication-quality image files.

title: Learning objectives
text: statistical models useful ? statistical populations, samples distributions? statistical variables type relationships exist variables? linear model components?

title: Learning objectives
text: Perform basic data wrangling R (filtering mutating data). Fit linear model one continuous outcome variable one continuous predictor lm(). Interpret summary model understand meaning reported coefficients. Plot diagnose model describe model specification results writing.

title: Learning objectives
text: can use linear models categorical (rather continuous) predictors? need code categorical predictors numbers? common coding methods? can represent linear model using formula? interpret linear model continuous categorical predictors?

title: Learning objectives
text: Read data R obtain grouped summaries. Master contrast coding R categorical predictors. Fit, interpret plot linear models continuous categorical predictors. Advanced reporting model specification results.

title: Learning objectives
text: Gaussian data common? can model non-Gaussian data? properties binary outcomes (‘yes/’, ‘true/false’) counts? linear models use log-odds odds instead probabilities?

title: Learning objectives
text: Fit, interpret plot linear models binary outcome variables, using Bernoulli/binomial distribution family. Fit, interpret plot linear models count outcome variables, using Poisson distribution family. Convert log-odds, odds probabilities. Recognise different types outcome variables.

title: Learning objectives
text: class week. Instead, asked catch materials covered far, complete short formative assessments, participate class discussions Piazza.

title: Learning objectives
text: makes data “tidy”? makes “untidy”? centering /scaling continuous variables helpful? z-scores? model interactions two variables?

title: Learning objectives
text: Tidy messy data R dplyr tidyr. Centre, scale z-score continuous predictors. Fit, interpret plot linear models interactions (continuous * continuous, continuous * categorical, categorical * categorical). Reporting models interactions.

title: Learning objectives
text: makes data hierarchical? Can pool information different groups data? fixed varying effects related pooling? shrinkage useful?

title: Learning objectives
text: Fit, interpret plot linear model varying effects using lmer(). Understand varying intercepts slopes variance coefficients. Deal model convergence singularity issues. Report models varying effects.

title: Learning objectives
text: statistical inference? Null Hypothesis Significance Testing? p-values? ? p-values guarantee “truth”?

title: Learning objectives
text: Define statistical population sample. Obtain interpret p-values. Recognise avoid common misconceptions p-values. Report p-values.

title: Learning objectives
text: much willing risk getting false positive result? statistical power related false negative results? Questionable Research Practices (QRP) avoid ? important know required minimal sample size?

title: Learning objectives
text: Understand alpha, beta statistical power. Understand Type-, II, M S errors. Master Open Research practices prevent QRPs. Run power analyses simr calculate required minimal sample size.

title: Statistics and Quantitative Methods (Frequentist)
text: course cover basics statistics quantitative data analysis, design studies effectively address intended research questions. Students learn principles data visualisation statistical modelling develop practical skills necessary perform analyses. course draw examples different branches linguistics provide students hands-experience open science practices. course teach carry statistical inference using Null Hypothesis Significance Testing correctly interpret p-values confidence intervals.

text: tibble contains data study discussed Winter Grawunder 2012.

title: The phonetic profile of Korean formal and informal speech registers — polite
The phonetic profile of Korean formal and informal speech registers — polite
text: tibble::tibble 224 rows 29 variables: subject Subject unique identifier (categorical). gender Gender subject (categorical). birthplace Birth place subject (categorical). musicstudent subject music training? (binary: yes, ) scenario Unique identifier different items. task Task type (categorical: = mailbox task vs dct = discourse completion task). mailbox task people left note somebody's mailbox, discourse completion task prompted role-play start conversation. attitude Attitude (binary: pol polite vs inf informal). total_duration Total duration utterances seconds (numeric). articulation_rate Number syllables per second (numeric). f0mn Mean fundamental frequency (f0) (numeric). f0sd Stadard deviation fundamental frequency (numeric). f0range Minimum maximum fundamental frequency (numeric). inmn Mean intensity (numeric). insd Standard deviation intensity (numeric). inrange Minimum maximum fundamental frequency (numeric). shimmer Local shimmer (likewise normalized amplitude difference consecutive periods) (numeric). jitter Local jitter (bsolute period--period difference divided average period) (numeric). HNRmn Mean Harmonics--Noise Ratio (numeric). H1H2 Difference first second harmonic (H1-H2) (numeric). breath_count Number audible breath intakes (count). filler_count Number oral fillers like "oh/ah" (count). hiss_count Number noisy breath intakes (count). nasal_count Number nasal fillers like "mh/nh" (count). sil_count Number silent pauses (count). ya_count Number occurences interjection "ya" (informal) (count). yey_count Number occurences interjection "yey" (polite) (count).

title: The phonetic profile of Korean formal and informal speech registers — polite
text: Bodo Winter, Sven Grawunder. 2012. phonetic profile Korean formal informal speech registers, Journal Phonetics 40(6). 808-815. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.wocn.2012.08.006
